alert.note: Alert for Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 22 at 9:46AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues across northeast Travis County. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Travis. * WHEN...Until noon CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas continuing at least through noon today. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 941 AM CST, There is light rain falling across parts of Travis County as of 945 AM with rain coming to an end within the next hour or so. Very little accumulations are expected for the next few hours. However, there are multiple street closures across the northeastern portion of Travis County with water slowly coming down. Therefore, the Flood Advisory is now in effect through noon today to allow the water levels to continue to come down. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.2 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that are likely experiencing flooding include... Austin, Round Rock, Pflugerville, Elgin, Windemere, Manor, Webberville, Wells Branch and Jollyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
